dialogues.ALICE:
[1]Cabin B is ready. 
[2]You told her to sweep the courts. 
[3]You can changed in three. 
[4]Steve said for you to start on the boats. 
[5]I'll tell him. 
[6]Everybody except the girl who's supposed to handle the kitchen.  Annie. 
[7]I'm not sure I'll last all week. I'll tell Steve. 
[8]Oh, thanks.  I wish I could spend more time at it. 
[9]Just a feeling. Nothing personal. 
[10]I don't know.  Probably be best for everybody. 
[11]Next Friday. 
[12]Sure. 
[13]How come? 
[14]Did you want something? 
[15]Un-hunh. 
[16]Oh, my God... 
[17]It's long and personal.  It has nothing to do with you or the other kids. 
[18]And it's this place.  It makes no sense, but it spooks me. 
[19]Artist. 
[20]What'd you see? 
[21]I walked into it knowing I'd get hurt, but I thought I could stand anything. I just wasn't ready for that kind of pain.  We were supposed to meet in L.A. When I got back there, he sent a telegram saying he was going back to his wife. 
[22]I don't know. 
[23]I'll be along. 
[24]I didn't know I was asleep...What time is it? 
[25]Now I'm only eleven hours behind schedule.  Steve is going to have a small cow. 
[26]And then Steve looks at you with those hurt eyes--like you don't care about children... 
[27]I'll see you later. 
[28]You're very nice. 
[29]Help! 
[30]There's a fucking snake in here. 
[31]How the... did he get in there? 
[32]Okay.  Can I help? 
[33]The way I feel, that's perfect. 
[34]Bad bulb or no power.  It's getting a little gloomy in here. 
[35]Tomorrow is another day. 
[36]This just plain ain't my day. 
[37]Somebody probably dropped something too hard. 
[38]Ned?  We're gonna be working together for a while.  You're a nice guy without all the entertainment, okay? 
[39]Sure. 
[40]You're welcome. 
[41]He went to bed early. 
[42]Jack and Marcie are gonna be drenched. 
[43]I'm not always this stupid. 
[44]It wouldn't matter except Steve should be getting back pretty soon.  It wouldn't look so great if he fell over them. 
[45]Well, it hasn't been that long. 
[46]I think we should go wake them up.  Just in case. 
[47]I guess... 
[48]Good night, Brenda. 
[49]Absolutely. 
[50]I don't here it anymore. 
[51]It sounded like Brenda. 
[52]Did somebody leave the lights on at the softball field? 
[53]They're off now. 
[54]Okay. 
[55]I'll go with you. 
[56]Brenda?  Brenda?  You there? 
[57]Bill. 
[58]What the fuck is going on here? 
[59]Marcie? 
[60]Marcie?  Brenda?  Jack? 
[61]I think we should call the police, Bill. 
[62]Do you have a dime?  A quarter? 
[63]Hello?  Hello?  This damn thing's dead, too. 
[64]What's the matter with it? 
[65]Why don't we run?  Just run now? 
[66]Bill?! 
[67]The generator... 
[68]Bill?  Bill? 
[69]Bill! 
[70]Bill? 
[71]Help!  Help! 
[72]Jack!  Marcie!  Help me! 
[73]The knife! 
[74]He's dead... She's dead... all dead... Please save me... oh... poor Bill... Oh my God, oh my God... oh God... 
[75]Jack?  Marcie?  Ned? 
[76]No, no, they're all dead... 
[77]They'll kill you!  Don't leave me! 
[78]All dead?  Neddy?  Oh, Marcie... 
[79]Bill--Bill--Bill is out there... 
[80]The killer is still out there. 
[81]Maybe we should wait for Mr. Christy. 
[82]I don't understand. 
[83]Why shouldn't we wait for Mr. Christy? 
[84]Mr. Christy will be back soon. 
[85]I won't let you! 
[86]No!  No!  No! 
[87]Where are the goddamned bullets? 
[88]Please... 
[89]Help me.
dialogues.BILL:
[1]I finished the boats. 
[2]Alice?  The others show up? 
[3]You think you're gonna last all summer? 
[4]No shit.  When? 
[5]Sorry.  How you doing? 
[6]Steve said you were thinking of leaving. True? 
[7]You okay? 
[8]You're lucky. 
[9]How come you're leaving? 
[10]Maybe I can help? 
[11]You're right.  It makes no sense. 
[12]Filmmaker. 
[13]It still hurts? 
[14]What'll you do when you leave here? 
[15]Speaking as black raspberry, I guess I'm ready.  Frozen yogurt? 
[16]Almost five. 
[17]You can only do what you can do. 
[18]Alice? 
[19]Hope you will. 
[20]Slipped in.  Probably liked the scent of your perfume. 
[21]You okay now? 
[22]NED                   Too bad that Annie never 
[23]Trouble? 
[24]For sure. 
[25]This is almost like the one at my uncle's cabin in Maine. 
[26]Don't get up.  Take a second... 
[27]I had to. 
[28]I figured if I didn't save you.  I'd have to give you mouth-to-mouth and that would have ruined my appetite. 
[29]This puddle was enough to ground you all the way to China. 
[30]A short somewhere. 
[31]There's the problem, Jack.  Wire worked itself loose. 
[32]Lemme see.  Doesn't look too bad. 
[33]Is it stuck? 
[34]Chance to get even? 
[35]Where's Ned? 
[36]Not if they're where I think they are. 
[37]Anything's possible.  My parents taught me to leave sleeping lovers alone. 
[38]Good point. 
[39]Got to it just in time.  The generator was running on fumes.  I filled it up. That should keep it humming until Steve gets back. 
[40]Help you clean up? 
[41]Can't hear anything through that wind and rain. 
[42]I'll go take a look. 
[43]Where? 
[44]I'll go check on Brenda. 
[45]If it'll make you feel better. 
[46]Jack? 
[47]Hey, guys! 
[48]Okay. 
[49]Sucker's locked.  Who's got the key? 
[50]It's dead.  Try the pay phone. 
[51]No.  There must be some in the desk somewhere. 
[52]Wet.  I don't know. 
[53]It's over twenty miles to the crossroads.  Steve'll be back in an hour.  Things will straighten out then. We'll take his Jeep and get help. 
[54]Don't worry.  There is probably some really stupid explanation for all this. When the sun comes up tomorrow, you'll smile. Promise. 
[55]Oh, shit....
dialogues.MARCIE:
[1]Sex is all you ever think of, Neddy. 
[2]You are a true pierce of work, Ned. 
[3]How about our last jay? 
[4]We got two weeks before the kids even arrive.  Then I'll act responsibly. Until then, hit me. 
[5]It's beautiful... 
[6]What are those for?  An Indian raid? 
[7]Here.  Meet me in my cabin after taps. Okay, Camper? 
[8]Neddy collects weird facts.  Next he is going to tell us that there are poisonous snakes in the outhouse and green lizards in the lake. 
[9]Help me!  Save me!  The frog people are after me!  It's swim time at Camp Crystal Lake.  Come on, Alice, I need protection! 
[10]Cowboy. 
[11]Okay, Fireman. 
[12]Rocky Road. 
[13]Pistachio, fudge ripple, creme de menthe and I are going back to work. 
[14]Steve never mentioned serpents.  Jack, would you get some paper towels? 
[15]Thanks. 
[16]Go ahead.  I walk on 'em all the time. Would you shovel Mr. Snake outta here? 
[17]How you doin'? 
[18]There's a lot of dishes if you just want something to do. 
[19]Last line of Gone With the Wind? 
[20]Soooooeeeeey, piggy, piggy. 
[21]Wait'll you're really in trouble and see what happens... 
[22]I hope that's the last time we see the Camp Crystal Lake Drama Program. 
[23]I don't blame him. 
[24]Yeah, like draining the lake! 
[25]Boy, we sure do have a lot of filthy small-minded people around here. Wait a minute, I'll get my diaphragm and be right with you. 
[26]Makes me want to hold on and never let go. 
[27]I love you. 
[28]What about Neddy? 
[29]He keeps on acting like such an asshole! 
[30]Don't call him. 
[31]I guess... 
[32]I'm a little scared of storms.  Always have been.  Since I was a kid. 
[33]I've dreamed this dream.  Maybe half a dozen times.  There is a thunderstorm. The rain comes down like pebbles.  I can hear the sound.  I try to close my ears off.  It doesn't work.  The sounds gets louder.  The rain turns to blood and the blood washes down in little rivers.  And the sound stops. 
[34]I call it my shower dream. 
[35]Lead the way! 
[36]Are you wet? 
[37]Mmmmmmmph? 
[38]Best over... 
[39]Like waves.  It's never been likes waves before. 
[40]Gotta pee.  You're lying on my bladder. 
[41]I know this ain't very romantic, but what can I say?  I don't want to explode. 
[42]"Forty yards to the outhouse by Willie Makit."  "The Yellow Stream by I.P. Daley."  Not the most original stuff, kids. 
[43]Jack? 
[44]Jack? 
[45]Jack?  Neddy?  Don't put me on. 
[46]Allee allee infree! 
[47]Must be my imagination.
dialogues.NED:
[1]There you are dead wrong. 
[2]Sometimes I only think about kissing women. 
[3]I was just wondering if you thought there'd by any other gorgeous women at Camp Crystal Lake.  Besides yourself. 
[4]What about the dope paragraph in Mr. Christy's letter? 
[5]Yeah, and it also look like it hasn't seen a coat of paint in six years. 
[6]I thought we had two weeks... 
[7]Looks good. 
[8]He neglected to mention this place is called "Camp Blood" downtown. 
[9]Some campers drowned.  Then some counsellors got killed. 
[10]Late fifties sometime.  They never caught the guy who did it either. 
[11]Did anyone ever tell you you're beautiful when you're angry? 
[12]Want to see my trick shot?  It's even better. 
[13]God, but I love that sexy talk. 
[14]What do you want to be when you grow up? 
[15]Girls can't be cowboys. 
[16]Jack? 
[17]Doctor.  Now, if you were a flavor of ice cream, what would you be? 
[18]There are sand sharks in this lake and they can eat the bathing suit right off you. 
[19]See?  I'm getting to you.  Very slowly. 
[20]Don't burn that gorgeous body, or I'll scratch your eyes out... 
[21]Holy shit... 
[22]Wait, wait!   When I was finding these goodies in the shed.  I also found this letter which a camper never sent home. Listen. 
[23]Dear Mom and Dad, Camp Blood is real fine except for the strange man who flies at night and sucks our counsellor's body... 
[24]And, Mommy, we really love our counsellor. He says that whenever I'm scared, I can sleep in his bunk with him. 
[25]No wonder they lost America.  How could you sneak around in the bushes wearing that?  What's to eat? 
[26]The squaws are revolting! 
[27]God, but I love that macho talk! Emergency generators!  The Indian used campfires. 
[28]What hath God wrought? 
[29]Ha!  You wily oriental!  The phone was "Mr. Watson, come in here, I need you." "What hath God wrought" was the telegraph. 
[30]Frankly, Scarlet, I don't give a damn! 
[31]Who played the role of Gorgon in Star Trek? 
[32]ALICE                 Aaaargh!  That my 
[33]Alice, you're just lucky there are no snakes in the dishwater here. 
[34]Ta-da! 
[35]But it's in the brochure!  "Camp Crystal Lake has a full drama program."  You just saw it. 
[36]Hey, look, I'm sorry.  I'll never do it again. 
[37]I'm sorry. 
[38]Tell 'em I'm sorry? 
[39]I'm gonna go lie down and catch some z's.  Today wiped me out. Thanks, Alice. 
[40]Hello?  Can I help you?
dialogues.JACK:
[1]Ha! 
[2]Ow! 
[3]Good call. 
[4]Quote:  Controlled substances are expressly forbidden.  Possession or use of marijuana or alcohol on campgrounds will means instant dismissal.  Unquote. 
[5]Steve's got a woodlore program.  You see any life rings? 
[6]For sure. 
[7]You want it listed separately? 
[8]Coach, athletic director somewhere. 
[9]BRENDA                Four zip. 
[10]It's gonna be a long summer. 
[11]Steve taught me how to use the emergency generator.  The town power lines are supposed to be real shitty. 
[12]Give me a hand? 
[13]Here we go. 
[14]Now ya' close the switch. 
[15]I'll be okay.  Holy shit... 
[16]You saved my life. 
[17]Thanks. 
[18]Whew. 
[19]Floor probably leaks.  This area is full of springs. 
[20]Just in cause this bugger goes bad.  I'm gonna pick up some lanterns from the equipment shack. 
[21]What is it? 
[22]Not funny, Ned... 
[23]I'll spot you five points. 
[24]You just had some lucky shots. 
[25]Hey, how about a walk by the lake? 
[26]Just a walk, for Chrissakes. 
[27]Wind's up.  It's shifted a good hundred and eighty degrees. 
[28]I love you. 
[29]I don't love Neddy. 
[30]Ned! 
[31]I thought you wanted to give him one of your motherly lectures.  Ned is gonna do whatever he wants to do, you know. 
[32]Looks like a storm. 
[33]You?  The brick? 
[34]It's just a dream. 
[35]This is no dream.  Want to escape for a while? 
[36]Just a little.  Wait a minute, woman. 
[37]Mmmmmmmph. 
[38]Umhummmmph. 
[39]Whassamatta?
dialogues.STEVE:
[1]Wanta give me a hand here? 
[2]Alice? 
[3]Wanta roll this sucker out of the way. Alice? 
[4]Push on this side.  Alice, this is Jack, Marcie and Ned.  Push. 
[5]That's got her.  Thanks.  I'm Steve Christy.  Welcome to Camp Crystal Lake. You got some grubby clothes?  Climb into 'em.  Alice, see if Bill has cleaned out the boathouse.  I want him to start with the canoes.  What happened to Brenda? 
[6]I'd rather she painted.  Let's go, folks. 
[7]Shim it up just a scooch. 
[8]Perfection.  Hold it. 
[9]To answer your question, my parents once owned this camp.  There were some tragic accidents and they went bankrupt.  I promised them I'd reopen if I could. See if it closes right now. 
[10]Perfection. Did you meet Brenda? 
[11]She's archery.  He's rifle ranged.  And I'm behind schedule.  Let's go, Ned. 
[12]Come on back here and let's above the float in. 
[13]You draw very well. 
[14]This isn't your cup of tea, hunh? 
[15]Any particular reason? 
[16]You want to leave? 
[17]You may not care a lot about this place, Alice, but I mean to make it my whole life.  It's been my whole life.  Gimme a chance.  Stay a week.  Help get it ready.  Next Friday, if you're not happy, I'll put you on the bus myself. I'll be grateful. 
[18]Thanks, Alice. 
[19]I've got to go to town and pick up the trailer and all that other stuff, but I'll be back around ten.  If you're still up, we can talk, okay? 
[20]Yeah.  Brenda, after lunch hit the archery range.  If Annie gets here, have her start in on the kitchen.  Do your best.  Tomorrow we have a preliminary inspection by the state safety people. I'd like to look good. 
[21]No, thanks.  I'm fine.  Sandy. 
[22]I got to. 
[23]I have six new counsellor up there. They're all babes in the woods in every sense of the word. 
[24]I mean... 
[25]Yeah.  I got it on before this-- --all started. 
[26]For two lonely nights. 
[27]I think water got into the electrical system.  You ride me back to camp?  I'll get one of my counsellors to drive me back tomorrow morning. 
[28]You've made a science out of coincidence. 
[29]Sure. 
[30]Good luck. 
[31]Yeah. 
[32]Hi.  What are you doing out in this mess?
dialogues.BRENDA:
[1]You're crazy! 
[2]I don't believe you... 
[3]You ever fire one of those bows again, and I'll tack you up on the wall to dry. 
[4]Dancer. 
[5]Vitamin C's supposed to neutralize the nitrites or something. 
[6]I don't know.  Marcie's got me paranoid. 
[7]Not bad. 
[8]We wouldn't want you thinking you're the only show-off in camp, would we? 
[9]It's catch as catch can.  I'm making a salad.  The guys are planning to cook greaseburgers for themselves. 
[10]Whatever you make yourself. 
[11]That was the telephone. 
[12]Shows how much you know.  It's something about tomorrow. 
[13]Right!  Right! 
[14]Wash it out real good. 
[15]He's probably setting up another one of his practical jokes. 
[16]You think they fell asleep? 
[17]Long enough for me. 
[18]Give them a little while longer.  It's still early, anyway. 
[19]Good night, Alice. 
[20]That could drive a person bug-city. 
[21]Neddy?  Cut the screwing around, Neddy! 
[22]This isn't even half funny. 
[23]Christ, what a jerk. 
[24]Great.  Now what? 
[25]Looks like I turn in early.
dialogues.ANNIE:
[1]Excuse me.  How far is Camp Crystal Lake? 
[2]Can I get a bus or something? 
[3]Name's Annie. 
[4]I don't know. 
[5]Camp Crystal Lake? 
[6]No sweat.  Thanks a lot for the lift. 
[7]Hiya!  I'm headed for Camp Crystal Lake. Can you help me out? 
[8]I can't remember being this excited about anything.  I want to be a teacher when I finish at Southern State.  I guess I've always wanted to work with children.  I hate it when people call 'em kids.  Sounds like little goats. 
[9]The job market for teachers is supposed to be the pits these days, but I don't care.  When you have a dream as long as I have, you'll do anything... 
[10]Wasn't that Camp Crystal Lake?  Just back there? 
[11]I think we better stop... Please stop... Please!  Stop! 
[12]Please!
dialogues.CLAUDETTE:
[1]Have you seen Barry? 
[2]We've got to talk. 
[3]You said we were special. 
[4]I can't, Barry... 
[5]Does Chloe kiss as good as I do? 
[6]Oh, you... 
[7]Somebody'll see. 
[8]Somebody's there, Barry. 
[9]Let's go back, Barry...
dialogues.BARRY:
[1]Okay. 
[2]I meant everything. 
[3]You know what I said, though. 
[4]I care very much. 
[5]I wouldn't know. 
[6]Claudette... 
[7]No, they won't... 
[8]Come on, Claudette.  A man's not made of stone. 
[9]I need you so much, Claudette.
dialogues.SANDY:
[1]Anything else you want? 
[2]You can't go back there tonight.  Not in that stuff.  'Less you wanta get drownded. 
[3]Aw. 
[4]They'll be okay if they know enough to stay in outta the rain. How much do I owe you? 
[5]One night on the town. 
[6]...I know what you mean.  Two and a quarter.  Plus fifteen percent tip to make up for me spending the night alone. 
[7]You got a roof for that Jeep? 
[8]That's thirty percent. 
[9]Drive careful and don't drownd your dumb self.
dialogues.OIL MAN:
[1]No sweat, Trudy.  Let's do it to it, kid. 
[2]Okay, Annie.  Let's go. 
[3]All the girls up there gonna look as good as you? 
[4]Goddamnit, Ralph!  Get outta here. Don't worry about him.  He's harmless. G'won.  Git! 
[5]Climb on up, Miss. 
[6]Must be the fourth time somebody's tried to reopen that place. 
[7]Something always happens up there. 
[8]Don't let the spooks getcha, Annie.
dialogues.TIERNEY:
[1]I told you not to buy that hunk of junk! 
[2]Why not? 
[3]"To serve and protect" don't mean to chauffeur. 
[4]Bad enough we got a full moon; it's Friday the 13th.  They keep statistics. We get more accidents, more robberies, more rapes, more homicides, more of everything when there's a full moon.  It affects people.  Makes 'em nuts. 
[5]This is Tierney. 
[6]Roger.  Acknowledge receipt.  Estimate arrival time fifteen minutes.  How copy? 
[7]Have to drop you here, Steve. 
[8]Another coincidence.
dialogues.JASON:
[1]Help me, mommy... save me... please, mommy... please, mommy... help me, mommy... save me.... 
[2]Help, mommy, I'm drowning!  Oh, mommy, please.... 
[3]Don't let me die, mommy... I can't breathe... Help me, breathe... 
[4]Kill her, mommy!  Kill her! 
[5]Please kill her, mommy... Help me, please.  Kill her, mommy. 
[6]Come out, come out, wherever you are... 
[7]Mommy!  Mommy!  Mommy! 
[8]Kill her, mommy!  Kill her, mommy!
